paper_title.en: Local density of states around impurity in a strong magnetic field: I. Two-dimensional system with parabolic dispersion

description.en: Bound states around an impurity are investigated for a two-dimensional electron system in a strong magnetic field. Long-range Coulomb potential and related potentials are considered. The Schrodinger equation is solved numerically to obtain the bound states. The energy and wave function of these bound states are indirectly observed by scanning tunneling spectroscopy as the local density of states (LDOS). Theoretically obtained LDOS is compared with results of experiment. Reasonable agreement is obtained.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.ja: Real-Space Imaging of Alternate Localization and Extension of Quasi-Two-Dimensional Electronic States at a Graphite Surface in Magnetic Fields
Ground state of nu=1 bilayer quantum Hall systems
Real Space Effective Interaction and Phase Transition in the Lowest Landau Level(共著)
paper_title.en: Real space effective interaction and phase transition in the lowest Landau level

description.en: The transition between the stripe state and the liquid state in a high magnetic field is studied by the density-matrix renormalization-group (DMRG) method. Systematic analysis on the ground state of two-dimensional electrons in the lowest Landau level shows that the transition from the stripe state to the liquid state at v similar to 3/8 is caused by a reduction of repulsive interaction around r similar to 3l. The same reduction of the interaction also stabilizes the incompressible liquid states at v = 1/3 and 2/5, which shows a similarity between the two liquid states at v similar to 3/8 and 1/3. It is also shown that the strong short-range interaction around r similar to l in the lowest Landau level makes qualitatively different stripe correlations compared with that in higher Landau levels.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.ja: Nontrivial behavior of the Fermi arc in the staggered-flux ordered phase(共著)
paper_title.en: Nontrivial behavior of the Fermi arc in the staggered-flux ordered phase

description.en: The doping and temperature dependences of the Fermi arc in the staggered-flux, or the d-density wave, ordered phase of the t-J model are analyzed using the U(1) slave boson theory. Nontrivial behavior is revealed by the self-consistent calculation. In the low doping and finite-temperature region, both the length of the Fermi arc and the width of the Fermi pocket are proportional to delta and the area of the Fermi pocket is proportional to delta(2). This behavior is completely different from that at zero temperature, where the area of the Fermi pocket becomes pi(2)delta. This behavior should be observed by detailed experiments of angle-resolved photoemission spectroscopy in the pseudogap phase of high-T-c cuprates if the pseudogap phase is the staggered-flux ordered phase.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

Nontrivial behavior is revealed by the self-consistent calculation. paper_title.ja: Gap evolution in ν=1/2 bilayer quantum Hall systems(共著)
Theory of ``Charge" Measured by the Shot Noise Experiment in the Fractional Quantum Hall Effect
Stripes in the Lowest Landau Level(共著)
paper_title.en: Stripe state in the lowest Landau level

description.en: The stripe state in the lowest Landau level is studied by the density matrix renormalization group (DMRG) method. The ground state energy and pair correlation functions are systematically calculated at various pseudopotentials in the lowest Landau level. We show that the stripe state in the lowest Landau level is realized only in a system whose width perpendicular to the two-dimensional electron layer is smaller than the order of magnetic length.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN

paper_title.ja: Ground State Phase Diagram of 2D Electrons in High Magnetic Field(共著)
paper_title.en: Ground state phase diagram of 2D electrons in high magnetic field

description.en: The ground state of 2D electrons in high magnetic field is studied by the density matrix renormalization group method. The ground state energy, excitation gap, and pair correlation functions are systematically calculated at various fillings in the lowest and the second lowest Landau levels. The ground state phase diagram, which consists of incompressible liquid state, compressible liquid state, stripe state, pairing state, and Wigner crystal is determined.

publication_name.en: JOURNAL OF THE PHYSICAL SOCIETY OF JAPAN
